adjective.description: Of or relating to bats of the Old World microchiropteran family Rhinolophidae, which comprises the horseshoe bats; designating such a bat.

noun.description: A rhinolophid bat; a horseshoe bat.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Henry Johnston (1842–1919). From scientific Latin Rhinolophus, genus name + -id, after scientific Latin Rhinolophidae, family name.
